snippet: New York State was right to order an investigation of firms that advertise payments as advances, not high-cost loans, to pensioners.
abstract: Editorial praises New York Gov Andrew Cuomo for ordering state's top banking regulator to investigate 'pension advance' firms that persuade customers to sign over all or part of their monthly pensions in exchange for immediate cash payments; contends such advances are cleverly disguised loans and are clearly illegal.
lead_paragraph: New York State was right to order an investigation of firms that advertise payments as advances, not high-cost loans, to pensioners.
